review: I am so sick and tired of Direct TV and their endless phony reality shows.  And the gouging costs!!!!  So we decided to give this a try.  After all I love reading but couldn't believe that Kindle could be a good reading experience and I absolutely love the Kindles...we have four now, and more books than I ever thought possible to get in our little house.  And I love the Kindle reading experience, probably spend 4-6 hours a day reading....So now we look forward to learning how to use the Fire Stick....and being able to watch what and when we wish.  good riddance to Direct TV and many many thanks to Amazon for all the cool stuff they keep creating.  I think they are making my old age much better than it would have been!

review: This is a great, great device.We have a rook and a chromcast to stream and this is my favorite.The Roku is good, but the last version keeps breaking and they don't have as many agreements with movie channels as Chromecast and Amazon do.Chromecast is so-so.  The app section is better, but not having a remote is not convenient (for our family at least) and we have found that when we travel, the wifi better be VERY strong for any hope of the chromecast working.  Another downside to the Chromecast is their lack of partnership with Amazon.The GUI on the fire is great.  There are a few things I would change- like having a favorite app section on the home screen to easily navigate to other "channels" right now we mostly use "most recent" and I wish the "back" button and "home screen" button on the remote were in a different spot.  Overall- little things compared to being able to have channels like HBO, Showtime, Starz and Encore- along with the big three streamers; Amazon, Netflix and Hulu.
